column1: Toguchin (Russian: Тогучи́н) is a town and the administrative center of Toguchinsky District in Novosibirsk Oblast
column3: located on the Inya River (Ob's tributary) 125 kilometers (78 mi) east of Novosibirsk
column4: the administrative center of the oblast. Population: 21

column1: It was founded as a village in the 17th century. Town status was granted to it in 1945.
Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Toguchin serves as the administrative center of Toguchinsky District. As an administrative division
column3: it is incorporated within Toguchinsky District as the Town of Toguchin. As a municipal division
column4: the Town of Toguchin is incorporated within Toguchinsky Municipal District as Toguchin Urban Settlement.

column1: Town's industrial facilities include a water-accumulator installations plant
